Article.Abstract: In order to determine highly immunogenic severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV) epitope peptides capable of inducing long-lasting immunity, we first screened immunoglobulin-G (IgG) antibodies reactive to 197 different overlapping 15-mers from the SARS-CoV proteins in the sera of three infected patients. Forty-two peptides among them were reactive to the sera from all three patients. Consequently, we tested for the reactivity of these 42 peptides to patients' sera (n = 45) at 6-month post-infection. The significantly higher levels of IgG antibodies specific to three (S791, M207 and N161) of 42 peptides were detectable in the post-infection sera from 23 (51%), 27 (60%) and 19 (42%) of 45 patients, respectively. These three peptides, recognized by their long-lasting immunity, may provide a better understanding of the immunogenicity of SARS-CoV.
Article.ArticleTitle: Assessment of synthetic peptides of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus recognized by long-lasting immunity.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Immunology, Kurume University School of Medicine, Asahi-machi, Kurume, Fukuoka, Japan.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay; Humans; Immune System(immunology); Immunity(immunology); Immunoglobulin G(blood); Peptides(immunology); Rheology; SARS Virus(immunology); Serum(immunology)

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The sera of Vietnamese SARS-CoV patients 6th months post infection was tested for reactivity to the epitope byflow cytometry analysis with Luminex<sup>TM</sup>. Three early-stage Taiwanese SARS-CoV-infected patients gave positive responses when tested for reactivity to the epitope.

The sera of Taiwanese early stage SARS-CoV-infected patients (n=3) was tested for reactivity to the epitope byflow cytometry analysis with Luminex<sup>TM</sup> using three different serum dilutions (100-, 1,000- and 10,000-fold).
The sera of Vietnamese SARS-CoV patients (n=45) 6th months post infection was tested for reactivity to the epitope byflow cytometry analysis with Luminex<sup>TM</sup> at a serum dilution of 1:100.
